result.execSummary:
The defendant Bronson M Weiss was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber or Electronic Monitoring if the jail deems it appropriate.
Collected by the Clerk of Courts
Complete AODA and follow through with recommendations.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt:
9:33 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Bronson M Weiss in court.  Attorney Kira Leigh Visser in court for Bronson M Weiss. 
There is an agreement which the Defense recites. 
Defendant pleads Guilty to Amended Count 1: OWI (3rd) and acknowledges prior convictions to support a finding of Guilt to a 3rd OWI. 
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Court accepts plea and finds the defendant Guilty. Anything else is dismissed and read in. 
Court orders: Defendant to pay $2,502 (fine + costs) and the mayo blood draw fee. Defendant to serve 80 days in jail with Huber or Electronic Monitoring if the jail deems it appropriate. 
Defendant's license is revoked for 27 months and must install an IID for 27 months after license is reinstated. Defendant to complete AODA and follow through with recommendations.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights (with attachments)
Plea hearing on August 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Plea hearing on July 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Plea hearing on August 4, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Motion hearing on September 15, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

(Case called at 9:15 AM)
Defendant Bronson M Weiss in court.  Attorney Kira Leigh Visser in court for Bronson M Weiss. Attorney Angela Lynn Beranek in court for State of Wisconsin.
State outlines that only one officer was subpoenaed for today's hearing (officer for field sobriety tests was mistakenly not subpoenaed).  Defense makes objection, but agrees to continue with testimony with officer who is present today.  State calls Officer Derek Jack to the stand - sworn and testifies.  Exhibit #1 is marked (recording from squad camera) but not played due to technical issues.  Cross-examination by Defense.  Re-direct by the State.  Re-cross by Defense.  
Motion Hearing: September 15, 2022 at 2:30 (2 hours; In person)
Motion hearing on July 14, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Dated 05/04/2022, Letter from DDA Beranek to Court regarding witness availability and no need to reset Motion Hearing.
Dated 05/03/2022, Letter from DDA Beranek to Court regarding witness unavailability and request to reschedule Motion Hearing.
Motion hearing on July 21, 2022 at 11:30 am.

(Case called at 11:16 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Bronson Weiss appears in person. Attorney Kira Visser appears separately by video for the Defendant. ADA Afton Lewis appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense waives reading of the complaint. Defendant updates his phone number. Time limits for preliminary hearing waived. 
Pre-Trial Conference: 04/11/2022 at 3:00 PM.  Hearing: 05/02/2022 at 9:30 AM.

Conditions; 
Defendant not to drive without a valid driver's license.  
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.  
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold.

Conditions;
